clinical_study.brief_title: Study on Safety and Performance of Medtentia Mitral Valve Repair System in Surgical Repair of Mitral Regurgitation
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Safety and Performance of the Medtentia Mitral Valve Repair System When Used in Adults Undergoing Mitral Valve Repair Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the trial is to demonstrate the safety, performance and implantability of the Medtentia Annuloplasty Ring (MAR) during mitral valve repair surgery. In addition, the trial aims to demonstrate that the MAR fulfills the requirements for mitral valve annuloplasty rings.

primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the safety of using the MAR and its accessories for mitral valve repair surgery, in terms of survival from surgery to hospital discharge

primary_outcome.measure: Change in mitral regurgitation from baseline to three months as measured by trans thoracic ECHO (echocardiography)
primary_outcome.description: Success will be defined as an improvement in at least 2 degrees in mitral regurgitation class as described in the ACC/AHA Guidelines for the Management of Patients with Valvular Heart Disease

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 30 days, 3 months, 6 months,1 year, 1,5 years and 2 years after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence frequency and timing of treatment-emergent major adverse cardiac events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From surgery to end of study (2 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as stroke and clinically significant myocardial infarction

secondary_outcome.measure: Mitral regurgitation as seen in trans esophageal ECHO performed during surgery before and after annuloplasty
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During surgery before and after the implantation

secondary_outcome.measure: Mitral regurgitation measured with trans thoracic ECHO
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 3 months until end of study (2 years)

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence, nature and frequency of treatment-emergent AEs, in particular severe SADEs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From surgery until end of study (2 years)

other_outcome.measure: Change on defined MR parameters, as measured using trans thoracic ECHO
other_outcome.time_frame: At screening and at each follow-up visit
other_outcome.description: Defined as MR class (none, trivial, mild, moderate, severe), Left ventricle reverse remodeling, Coaptation height

other_outcome.measure: Duration of the key stages of the annuloplasty procedure in minutes and seconds
other_outcome.description: MAR implantation time, MAR rotation time, Suturing time, Aortic clamp time, Cardiac arrest time.

intervention.intervention_name: Mitral valve repair using Medentia Annuloplasty Ring

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Informed consent form signed by the subjects.
- Candidate for mitral repair surgery according to European guidelines from the European Society of Cardiology (ESC)/US guideline from the American Heart Association (AHA).
- Technically feasible potential candidate for MAR implantation (appropriate ring size confirmed and selected during surgery).
- Life expectancy more than 24 months.
- Subjects able to attend all scheduled visits and comply with all study procedures.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any previous cardiac surgery.
- Have ejection fraction below 30%
- Subjects to undergo concomitant cardiac repair or replacement other than CABG, tricuspid valve repair and ablation therapy for correction of atrial fibrillation.
- Have any structural hindrance that would make use of the MAR technically infeasible
- Evidence of acute MI within 30 days of the intended mitral valve surgery .
- History of stroke within the last 12 months or stroke that has caused major neurological dysfunction and/or significant carotid artery disease (subjects with carotid stenosis â‰¥50% and/or ulceration).
- Recent or evolving bacterial endocarditis or subjects under antibiotic therapy.
- Restricted mobility of the mitral apparatus that results in a valvular area less than 3.0 cm2.
- Be in need of annular decalcification.
- Have any comorbidities or conditions that would be a contraindication to open heart surgery or that would place the patient at an unacceptable surgical risk.
- Subjects in whom transoesophageal ECHO/Doppler is contraindicated.
- Have any recent psychiatric disorder, including drug or alcohol abuse, that in the Investigator's opinion could impair the patient's compliance with study procedures.
- Be currently or have in the preceding 30 days participated in any other study involving an investigational drug or device.
- Be an employee of the investigational site directly affiliated with this study, the sponsor or the clinical research organization or have an immediate family member who is.
